titleStmt.title: A true narration of the royall fishings of Great Brittaine and Ireland. Instituted Anno 1632, and prosecuted by the Right Honourable, Philip, Earle of Pembrook and Montgomery, and his associats, untill Anno 1640, from the river of Thames. Whereunto is added a discovery of new trades, for the employing of all the poore people and vagrants in the kingdomes. / By Simon Smith, agent for the royall fishing.
titleStmt.author: Smith, Simon, Agent for the Royall Fishing.

titleStmt.title: A true narration of the royall fishings of Great Brittaine and Ireland. Instituted Anno 1632, and prosecuted by the Right Honourable, Philip, Earle of Pembrook and Montgomery, and his associats, untill Anno 1640, from the river of Thames. Whereunto is added a discovery of new trades, for the employing of all the poore people and vagrants in the kingdomes. / By Simon Smith, agent for the royall fishing.
titleStmt.author: Smith, Simon, Agent for the Royall Fishing.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E. P. for Nicholas Bourne, at the south entrance of the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
